storyInfo: Bena finds Annie watching Kirara play games, and out of curiosity, Bena joins in too. Upon learning that the game is based on ghost stories, Bena tells a Victorian 'ghost story' of her own to give Kirara a scare.

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Landship
Common Rest Area Passageway
Hrmm... Annie's off playing somewhere again...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: And she didn't even bring me. Hrmph.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I'll sort her out in short order.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh, a fork in the road.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: This way? Or that way?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh, forget it. Let's go with the old standby.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Brings out a Victorian coin)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Bena, Bena, oh lost Miss Prim♪ Where to go? Just listen to♪ him♪
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Here comes Sir Barkeley♪ The way is his whim♪
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Here!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Tosses coin)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Picks up coin)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: This way, all the way, then. Hm-hm, very well.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: *sigh*—I can't believe there were spots this wonderful, and Iris never once mentioned them to me.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: She clearly doesn't know Rhodes Island as well as she says, does she?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Aha! Found you!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Annie, you little—
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Urging Bena to whisper)
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Pointing at the person in front of the TV)
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: (Whisper) Psst, what's she up to?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Playing a game.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: A game? Aren't games supposed to be like chess, and swings, and building sandcastles, and other such things? Is this a game too?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Oh—
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: *shriek*! Did you just see a shadow pull someone off the screen into an alleyway?!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: My word, Grandmother would be furious if she knew we were watching this sort of thing!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Hmm, now...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I do slightly want to play.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Aha, I knew it!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: No wonder I couldn't find you.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Why don't you put a word in with the nice lady, then?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: That'll scare her.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Will it?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: It will.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Then you'll just have to allow me.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: After all, my play is your play.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: More power to you.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Oh, Annie, do you think I ought to put on a bit of a 'show' here?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Very well, as you wish.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Almost at the final part. Still don't know if I can manage the true end.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (I've gotten every collectible and every route, according to the guides.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Last step: beat the forced-loss fight.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (I tried it while I was getting all the ending medals earlier, and couldn't pull it off.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (I heard there was another phase transition to it, but I don't know if I can make it...)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Takes off headphones)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: H-Hello, did you need something?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Uh oh, I'm not good with kids. This won't end well.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: What are you doing, Miss?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: P... Playing a game.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: A game? I love games too!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Can I play with you?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Are all little kids so pushy these days?! Crap, what do I even do?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Can she actually play? Even if, I'm way into the endgame right now, and every enemy sucks to beat. I'm gonna feel terrible if she has a bad time and just drops the controller.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Uh, um, er, this...
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Do you not like to play with others...?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (I—I-I-I-Is she about to cry?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: No—no, no!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: We can play!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Thank you, Miss, you're the best!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: That's alright, heheh.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Haven't I seen this kinda now-we're-friends scene in a dating sim before?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Whatever... I can just start a fresh run in a bit, since I've got the whole route down. Why not let her have a go—)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (No, wait!)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (This is an action-horror suspense game with @@, and ## and **! What was the rating, D or Z?!)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (I can't be letting a kid play this!)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Miss?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Why don't we swap to another game, then? This one might be a little—
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: I want to play this one.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Can I?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Please, please, pick up what I'm putting out!)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: If you're 100% sure, then it's not—like you technically can't. But...
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Really?! Thanks, Miss!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Um?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: F—For what?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Do you use this control gadget to play?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Um, huh? That's—I meant—
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: And you press on these buttons.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Wow! A monster appeared!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What an impressively gaping mouth! How fearsome!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Just let me have the controller a sec!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Pause menu, Settings, Game Options, turn off Blood SFX—)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (—and most importantly, 'Disturbing Content': off!)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Hrm? Why's the wide-mouthed fiend become so hazy?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Don't worry about it! Here's the controller.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Alright. Thank you, miss~
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (This kid seems alright, aside from being so, um, forward. She talks sense, and she's sweet.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (If all my friends were that polite when I was young, I wonder if maybe I'd be riajuu material now, like Utage?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Don't get carried away, Kirara. Like heck.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Hrmph, hah, hey!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (She's almost to the final set piece battle.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Come to think of it, I just taught her how to use a controller.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (And I only figured that combo out not too long ago.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (How'd she learn it?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Could I have unleashed a dormant gamer god?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Is there finally someone who could help me clear the secret set piece in Toukouden 2 Tachibana Edition?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Nnn... can't be sure yet.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Let's see if she can get past the set piece in Nukenin's hidden route first.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Sawara the Silentious. Pretty tough to beat.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Oh, there's an animation.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Here it is, the nighttime Saeki Crossing!)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Wh-Why can't I hack my way through?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I may be meant to flee.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (That's why people love Ringo Software. The way they connect and guide you through levels is so well-done, it clicks even for the littlest kids.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Ugh, how are there still monsters on the road? How obnoxious!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: No rush, take it slow.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Careful. There'll be monsters from the car ahead and the stores streetside.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Right, right, right, for this set piece, you'll want to use the streetlamps to stall the big guy, if you can't afford to tank, and then you can sort out the mob.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Errm.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Use that big tornado move to clear them away a little.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: But don't use it too much. Save some SP for the set piece.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Can she understand what I'm even saying?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Step over here, and then—like that.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Seems she does.)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Wagh, this is a dead end!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: But it's got some room to maneuver.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You're in the set piece battle now. That one's usually invincible, but you can sac an item from your inventory at him and his invuln disappears.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Which one?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: This one, the 'Sachet of Consecration'. Equip to your inventory, then just use it like anything else.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Do I take aim at him?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mhm. You've got one chance.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: —A deadeye hit!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: The invuln barrier's gone. Now slam him with everything you've got.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Very well!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Waargh, what speed!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You can-NOT lose, okay? You only get to do this fight once per save, and losing means doing the whole thing over again!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Fifteen minutes later...
What do I do if I can't regenerate?!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Focus, he's low too!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Remember to evade and parry!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: You can't block that one, jump away jump away!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Get him, get him!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Counter, nice! Chain a skill in!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Nice, nice, weak point! Hit it!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Hei-yah!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Nice—niiiiiice!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: You got the achievement—you got it, you got it!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: G-Got what?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: The true end!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: True end? What do you mean, true end?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Didn't I just start playing a short while ago?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: That's 'cause I was already in the back part.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Oh, the staff credits are rolling, perfect. Let me tell you how the story goes in the first part of the game.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I can't read the words, after all. I've little choice but to rely on your narration...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (That's true, there's no Victorian release of the game. Impressive she had the patience to play for so long...)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Ahem. The game's called Nukenin, and it's about a nukenin—like the name—who left his homeland to live in a new nomadic city, and the story that happens there.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: What's a nukenin?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: They're... um... the nu-keh part is runaway, the nin is... they're assassins, killers from the shadows, does that make sense?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: And while this assassin was serving his master, uh, his lord, he saw his lord getting killed, and then was framed for the deed. So he had no choice but to leave the land for somewhere real far away.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: And then?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: So then he's where the story takes place, Shin-Aki City.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: The city's an actual real one. My super-riajuu friend Utage sent me a postcard from there once.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: The biggest thing about it is—all the ghost stories. Plenty of ghost stories all come from there.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: And most of them are from after the city got wrecked by a Catastrophe and rebuilt.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Like station stops that don't actually exist, this kinda mysterious guy where if you don't give him water he follows you all the way home and drinks all the water there, Aki figurines that like wandering out and calling their owners when they get lost and then find their own ways back, stuff like that.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (You hear that, Annie? The next time you go out to play, remember to call me.)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Yes.)
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Really mystical ones, really especially scary ones.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Oh, the staff roll's over. Now it's mega-hyped secret ending time!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Mmnn... mm?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Huh?!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Right, that had foreshadowing!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Oh my-Oh my god, everything makes sense now!!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Miss, what was that animation afterwards about?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: It all makes sense. You know how I just said the assassin moved to a new city? So, because he was such an expert at assassination and investigation, he started up this detective agency.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: And the big guy we just defeated in that set piece was called Sawara the Silentious, the oldest ghost story of Shin-Aki City.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: They say that at night, at the busiest crossing in the Saeki district, if you cross alone, you run into this Higashi ronin dressed in ancient clothes.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: He uses sign language to ask you something, and if you can't answer him, don't respond or try to run, he'll hunt you down and kill you. You end up in the endless icefields, or he goes down.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: My, does that really happen?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I dunno either. Utage said the crossing in Saeki's all full of fun and excitement, and there's people drinking at every sake joint, and once they're done with one, they move onto the next, and then it's next morning and they just go back home and change clothes and go straight to work. Nobody's ever seen any kinda mute ronin.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Socky joint? They serve drinks and sell socks in your country?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Y—Yeah...
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Anyway! This game's last hidden ending tells you that every ghost story in the entire city was descended from the oldest one, and then they spread out like tree roots.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Sawara wanted this Higashi place to become a city of ghost stories that outsiders would never see, and with that as his main thing, in the end he wanted to turn all of Higashi into a ghostly paradise!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Unfortunately, he met the protag, a guy from outside who probed out the whole thing.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: In the end, Protag beats the original ghost story, finds out the city's secret, and the whole tree of stories falls apart, turning the city back to normal.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Simply because he won the 'set piece'?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Because ghost stories need enough mystery to last in people's minds. That's how they survive and get passed on.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: If their true natures are revealed, the mystery disappears, and a million ghost stories lose their foundations all at once.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Their whole reason to exist is gone.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Oh? Oh-ho—)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (What a coincidence, I'd like a few things to 'last' in this lady's mind too.)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Here's my plan of action.)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You seem very happy, Miss.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: We beat the hidden route! No duh I'm happy! Super-happy, tera-happy!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Ahh—and I have no idea my new games are gonna get here—
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: I guess I'll head back to the dorms—
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Miss, might you wait a moment?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: I'd like to tell you a story too. Would that agree with you?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You've told me so much, and I haven't given you one word. I feel quite awkward for that.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh, do wait a moment. You must be thirsty, Miss. I'll bring you a cup of water.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Man, there she is... stepping up again...)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (What's going on?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Am I popular now?)
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Here's your water.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Thanks~
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: (Bait taken~)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Well, then. Let me tell you a ghostly story of a Victorian city in exchange.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: As a...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Thank-you.)
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Thank-you.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh, sure.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: It's not everyday someone wants to talk to me.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Oh, yeah! I'm Kirara. What do you want me to call you?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Can I tell you this tale before I answer?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Hee-hee. Thank you, Miss.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: This story begins in Victoria, in a place named Lyndon—
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: It's raining again...
And I don't know where Mum and Dad are...
Oh, well. I needn't wonder about them. They don't mean as much as a bowl of hot soup would.
Hey, you Caprinae scamp. What are you hanging outside my door for?
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Getting out of the rain. What else could I do?
Tch, you have the balls to sit right here when you can't even speak Victorian clearly? Go back to Leithanien where you came from.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Did you not understand me? Get lost, you're not welcome at my door.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: I'm just sitting here to avoid the rain. I'm not coming inside your home.
Don't know when to give up, do you?! Bloody prick! I can handle a scolding from that bloody long-horns foreman, but you think you can talk back to me, you little shit?
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Get out of my sight and never come back!
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Urgh...
It hurts...
Let's shelter somewhere else...
If it comes to the worst...
Dropping from the city's edge... shouldn't hurt too much...
Hm?
Has someone fallen over there too?
It seems to be... an old lady?
Eek!
Granny, granny, are you alright?
Thank you, little lamb. There are so few children who would help an old lady up these days.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Oh, the children here. All they know is to ask me for apples. Not a soul in sight the moment I'd like a little help from them.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: It's not often there's a child as kind to others as you. How good of you, how wonderful.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Granny, your clothes are dirty.
And yours, little lamb. Look, you've even gotten hurt here.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: I'll be alright. It'll wash away in the rain.
You silly lamb. What if you caught a cold, drenched like this?
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Hurry on back, now. I live quite close, and as rickety as I am, I can always make it home by myself.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Don't make your family worry.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: I... haven't got one...
My Mum and Dad asked me to wait for them at a fountain square, and then I never saw them again.
Well, dearie me. Poor little lamb.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Coincidentally, I live all by myself, I do, and it's very lonely. Would you mind a bit of a chat with an old woman like me?
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: A chat...? I don't see why not.
(At least I can get out of the rain.)
Hoho, thank you, little lamb.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Erk...
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: What's wrong, Granny?
I'm old, is what it is. Beyond repair.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Little lamb, could I trouble you to carry my fruit basket for me?
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: It's all full of apples I picked not a bit earlier. Oh, slipping over, carrying this heavy basket all the while. My arms and legs just don't have the strength.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: You're strong, little lamb. Could you help me?
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: I'll take over for you, Granny.
Say, Granny.
What is it?
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Why would you go apple-picking on a rainy day? With rains as stormy as this, wouldn't it be better to stay in?
Hohoho, you don't understand, little lamb.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Only the apples washed by rain like this are the good, strong and sweet ones.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Granny, is this the place?
Yes, it is.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Just wait one moment. Let me find my key.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Here it is.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Come in, little lamb.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Welcome home.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Why, how warm!
A-And how pretty!
Hohoho, I do like hearing a little flattery every now and then.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Now just hold still.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Ah! My wound—it's stopped hurting?
Though I've not much ability to speak of, I can find it in me to heal the little scrapes.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Would you like to change into something pretty?
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Mm-hm!
Then follow me, it's right upstairs.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: It's so—dark in here.
This is where my darling granddaughter rests, after all.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Rests? Granny, weren't you the only person here?
Yes, I've always been the only 'person' here.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Come, meet my darling granddaughter.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: This?
A doll? About as tall as me, and so finely detailed.
This is my granddaughter. Her name, you know, is Annie, an adorable Caprinae.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Just like you.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: You see, I've always been looking for something, and today I finally found it in you, little lamb.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: You've already helped so much. Granny is so very thankful.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Now, could you help me with one final thing?
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Anything, Granny.
Oh, thank you, you darling little lamb.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Well, then, please, close your eyes.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Little lamb, now.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: Take your delectable, kindly soul—
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: —and hand it out.
attributes.name: Old Granny

attributes.content: They say there's been cases of orphan abduction like that all over Victoria.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Occasionally, someone sees the old woman taking away an orphan, and all say after that night, they never see the orphan again.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: As one might imagine, the policemen never found anything much. They'd go knocking, and find either there were no old people at that house, or it would just be empty.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Though, one wrinkle is that every home had a doll named Annie.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I-Is that the end?
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: Yes, the end.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What do you think, Miss Kirara?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I-It's pretty good.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: It's an old yarn in Victoria at this point. I hear the cities have several variations on it, like—
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: That's okay! Thank you!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: If you're not fond of it, I won't tell.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: But, you know, no matter how the story changes, there's one thing that always stays the same.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Y-You can stop—I-I'm really not good with this sort of thing.
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: But you're fine with it in a game?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Playing a game is another thing!
attributes.name: Kirara

attributes.content: That does make sense, I suppose.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: In that case—
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Annie, come say hello.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hello, Miss Kirara.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: I am Annie.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Hee-hee, that never stops being fun.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What do you think? I'd say I was quite the performer.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You went too far, Bena.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Oh, relax, you. I'll give Miss Kirara a proper apology later.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Also.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: What else could there be?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You forgot to tell her.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Your name.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: My word!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Ugh, no need to get pernickety over that. I'll introduce myself when the time comes.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You made that up, just now?
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: That I did. I've got far better storytelling chops than Iris does, you know.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Granny will be upset, telling stories like that.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: You didn't make her evil enough.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Excuse meee—? Was that not evil enough? I think I've already made Grandmother out to be plenty rotten.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh... now that you say it, I suppose I can see it lacking a little.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Grandmother told me at first, if I'd run off with that basket that day, those five apples would've been my very last meals.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: And that wicked trap after she led me into the dining hall, then went to take a bath and change. If I so much as took a bite of the feast in there, I'd be sent right back out onto that stormy street before I could blink.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Now that was certainly real. I remember it even now.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: That left some very murky shadows on my young heart!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What Granny says is the truth.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: I wouldn't say she's rotten, otherwise!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I haven't even a clue how Granny first entered the Castle of Dreams.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Perhaps because she was a bad good person.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Just like me.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You're not bad.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Hrmph. What makes you think to try and grovel to me now?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Be good and confess, Annie. Did you or did you not play this game beforehand?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I did.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Then what was on your mind, dragging me here too?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I played it before. It was fun.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: I wanted you to play it too.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: I see, I see. So that's why the game controls felt so familiar to me.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: How many hours did you spend on it?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Three nights, twenty-four hours.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Twenty-four?! Did you sneak out at bedtime? Grandmother really will be mad!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I have you. I'm not scared.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Come over, Annie.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Here, sit by my side.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: We may have just passed this level, but we haven't touched the previous one at all.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Teach me very carefully, one-on-one, okay?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: And another thing. What did Miss Kirara mean with the 'set piece' she kept going on about?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Boss.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Oh, so that's all it was. And here I thought it was some strange new thing.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: It's started.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Oh, yes. Let's focus on the gaming, now.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What would you say? Do you think our scaring of Miss Kirara might really take root in her country, sprout forth into a new 'ghost story,' perhaps?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Focus, Bena.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: O-Oh, very well. Sorry.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: It's a push of this button, isn't it.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Game, start.
attributes.name: Bena
